9074.name: Amarettino Black Tea
9074.description: Blend from Ceylon and China containing ALMOND pieces, flavour and safflower.

7991.name: Assam BPS Typhoo Black Tea
7991.description: Strong broken tea blend with a fresh aftertaste. Good with milk.

8329.name: Assam Genteel FTGFOP Black Tea
8329.description: Strong, Assam blend with a classical long aftertaste.

9163.name: Assam Goldtips TGFOP Black Tea
9163.description: Assam blend with a classical long aftertaste.

7914.name: Assam TGFOP Satrupa Organic Black Tea
7914.description: The Satrupa plantation is located near the Brahmaputra River in the eastern region of Assam, near the border with Burma. The perfect ground conditions make this garden one of the best tea production areas in the world.
7914.ingredients: Indian organic black tea, with an intense flavor and a typical malt note. Certified organically grown: IT-BIO-013.

7879.name: Ayurveda Relax Herbal Tea
7879.description: This sweet and aromatic drink is an excellent digestive.
7879.ingredients: Cinnamon, ginger, liquorice, orange peel, cardamom, cloves, hibiscus, rosehips, raspberry and mallow leaves, fennel, linden blossoms, chamomile, black pepper.

7692.name: Bancha Green Tea
7692.description: Bancha is mainly grown in Shizuoka Prefecture. The harvest takes place in September-October, therefor his flavour is strong. The Bancha's taste is indeed rich but never bitter, but pleasantly soft on the palate.

9032.name: Beauty Herbal Tea
9032.description: Leaves of red screw, witch hazel and ginko biloba act on the peripherical cycle, they lessen fluid retention, swelling and the sense of weightiness. Aromatic and sweet flavor.
9032.ingredients: Leaves of red screw, witch hazel and ginko biloba, ruscus root, peppermint, star anise and liquorices. (Nutr. values 100ml: En. 18kJ/4kcal, fat 0g (sat. 0g), carb. 1,1g (sugar 0,8g), protein 0g, salt 0g)

8300.name: Bergamino Black Tea
8300.description: Flavoured black tea from Ceylon, India and China with lemon peel. The typical Earl Grey character is supported by a fruity lemon flavour which makes it a pleasant blend.
8300.ingredients: Black tea from Ceylon, India and China, lemon peel, natural flavor.

7796.name: Bitter Orange Black Tea
7796.description: Blend from Ceylon, China and India with natural orange flavour and orange blossoms.

7921.name: Body and Soul Herbal Tea
7921.description: Apple pieces, lemongrass, peppermint, chamomile, lemon peel, rosehips. Thanks to mint, lemongrass and lemon fruits this drink is an eccelent digestive drink.

8124.name: Caramel Black Tea
8124.description: Black tea blend with caramel bits and caramel flavour (it contains derivatives of MILK). (Nutr. values 100ml: En. 16kJ/4kcal, fat <0,1g (sat. <0,1g), carb. 0,8g (sugar 0,4g), protein 0,2g, salt <0,01g)

8478.name: Ceylon OP1 Pettiagalla Black Tea
8478.description: From Sri Lanka, characteristic of this tea is the black, long and wirily leaf. The taste is fresh and aromatic.

7731.name: Ceylon Orange Pekoe Blend Black Tea

9183.name: Chamomile Herbal Tea
9183.description: Mild chamomile flowers. It alleviates stomache ache and pyrosis.

8076.name: Chamomile Organic Herbal Tea
8076.description: Mild and Mellow organic chamomile flowers. From controlled organic cultivation: IT-BIO-013.

8390.name: China Keemun Black Tea
8390.description: Classical Chinese black tea from the province Anhui, also known as the “tea of the orchid”, middle-strong body, lightly smoky but with a sweet aftertaste.
8390.ingredients: "Classical Chinese black tea from the province Anhui, also known as the “tea of the orchid”, middle-strong body, lightly smoky but with a sweet aftertaste. "

8839.name: China Milky Oolong
8839.description: This kind of tea has it's origins in China (Fujian) and belongs to the sort of Oolong tea. Thanks to a special process of vaporization in milk and water the leaves get a toffee-like-sweet flavour. (Nutr. values 100ml: En. 4kJ/1kcal, fat <0,1g (sat. <0,1g), carb. 0,1g (sugar 0,1g), protein 0,1g, salt 0,01g)

8275.name: China Yunnan Pu Erh Black Tea
8275.description: Nowadays the teas are moisturized after the fermentation again and are stored in wide dark cellars for more than one year.
8275.ingredients: In the past the Pu Erh teas were buried in the ground where they got their unique tangy earthy taste. The perfermented tea has a red cup.

7841.name: Chocolate Black Tea
7841.description: Pure pleasure and no repent: chocolate truffle without calories! A wonderful Ceylon-China blend with the delicious flavour of chocolate truffles.

8055.name: Christmas Dream Black Tea

8354.name: Chun Mee Green Tea
8354.description: A green tea from the southern part of China. The name of this tea derives from ist typical shape which looks like an eyebrow. Tangy and strong cup.
8354.ingredients: A green tea from the southern part of China. The name of this tea derives from its typical shape which looks like an eyebrow. Tangy and strong cup.

8039.name: Corea OP Jeju Green Tea Bio
8039.description: One says that the first tea seeds were planted in 828 a.C and between 918 and 1392 a.C. the tea ceremony became popular. First official tea rooms with tea ceremonies were established. Only since 1980 Korean tea is produced in larger quantities so that smaller quantities can be also exported and are not only for the domestic tea consumption. The tea is harvested within a quite short period (within 7 days, mainly by the end of June).
8039.ingredients: This tea comes from Jeju Island in Korea which belongs to the world natural heritage of the Unesco. This Korean tea fascinates by its mild, smooth character and the leaf appearance shows a dark green, open, slightly twisted leaf. The taste is comparable to the taste of fine Japanese Sencha teas.

8121.name: Cranberry Queen Fruit Infusion
8121.description: Apple bits, raisins, carrot bits, beetroot, flavour, cranberries.

9191.name: Exotic Harmony Green Tea

8060.name: Fennel Herbal Tea
8060.description: Fennel seeds has been traditionally used as an aid to digestion and it has many health benefits.

9071.name: Forest Gifts Herbal Tea
9071.description: It has digestive properties, and it's a fabulous drink for those who search for something special and delicate.
9071.ingredients: Rosehips, spruce needles, daisy, strawberry-, peppermint-, blackberry- leaves, woodruff, raspberry and sage leaves, thyme, lime-tree blossoms.

9146.name: Garden Eden Fruit Infusion
9146.description: Apple, rosehips, hibiscus, elderberry, orange peel, strawberry pieces and strawberry-cream-flavour.

8040.name: Genmaicha Green Tea
8040.description: Genmaicha (""brown rice tea"") is the Japanese name for green tea combined with roasted brown rice. It is sometimes referred to colloquially as ""popcorn tea"" because a few grains of the rice pop during the roasting process and resemble popcorn. This type of tea was originally drunk by poor Japanese, as the rice served as a filler and reduced the price of the tea; which is why it is also known as the ""people's tea.
8040.ingredients: Genmaicha ("brown rice tea") is the Japanese name for green tea combined with roasted brown rice. It is sometimes referred to colloquially as "popcorn tea" because a few grains of the rice pop during the roasting process and resemble popcorn. This type of tea was originally drunk by poor Japanese, as the rice served as a filler and reduced the price of the tea; which is why it is also known as the people's tea.

8771.name: Ginger Green Tea
8771.description: A real chinese delight: green tea, ginger bits and aroma.

9241.name: Goji Berry Green Tea

8310.name: Golden Yunnan Black Tea

8165.name: Good Evening Herbal Tea

8482.name: Good Luck Charm Fruit Infusion

7901.name: Greek Mountain Herbal Tea
7901.description: The Sideritis Syriaca herb from the Mediterranean area is delicate, pleasant and renowned because of its antibiotic properties. It's useful to alleviate cough, sinusitis, neck ache. Delicate and sweet in taste.

9139.name: Green Forest Green Tea
9139.description: Sencha green tea from China, raisins, aroma, elderberry, strawberry pieces, raspberry pieces, raspberry, blackcurrant pieces.

7917.name: Green Manjolai Organic Green Tea
7917.description: Refreshing organic green tea grown in South India. Excellent green tea. Certified organically grown: IT-BIO-013.

8979.name: Green Rooibos Classic
8979.description: This Rooibos tea has its origins in South Africa. During the production the Rooibos is immediately dried so that it becomes green. Its property equates with the green tea.

8367.name: Green Rooibos Peach
8367.description: Green Rooibos with peach, flavour and sunflower petals. (Nutr. values 100ml: En. 2kJ/0kcal, fat0g (sat. 0g), carb. 0g (sugar 0g), protein 0,1g)

7986.name: Green Rooibos Vanilla and Lemon
7986.description: Apple, green rooibos, lemongrass, orange, verbena, vanilla, vannila and lemongrass flavour.

8392.name: Gunpowder Menthos Green Tea
8392.description: Green Chinese Gunpowder tea, enriched with natural mint-oil. (Nutr. values 100ml: En. 2kJ/ 0kcal, fat 0g (sat. 0g), carb. 0g (sugar 0g), protein 0,1g)

8006.name: Gunpowder Temple of Heaven Green Tea
8006.description: The original ""Temple of Heaven"" is a temple in Bejing. The tea for this blend is always harvested at the same estates. The quality is continiously the same on the entire international market. Dark green and tightly rolled leaf, tenderly bitter and tangy taste.
8006.ingredients: The original "Temple of Heaven" is a temple in Bejing. The tea for this blend is always harvested at the same estates. The quality is continiously the same on the entire international market. Dark green and tightly rolled leaf, tenderly bitter and tangy taste.

7742.name: Gyokuro Green Tea
7742.description: Gyokuro (Japanese: jade dew) is a type of shaded green tea from Japan. It differs from the standard sencha (a classic unshaded green tea) in being grown under the shade rather than the full sun. Gyokuro is shaded for approximately three weeks. The name gyokuro translates as jade dew, referring to the pale green colour of the infusion.
7742.ingredients: Gyokuro (Japanese: jade dew) is a type of shaded green tea from Japan. It differs from the standard sencha (a classic unshaded green tea) in being grown under the shade rather than the full sun. Gyokuro is shaded for approximately three weeks. The name gyokuro translates as jade dew, referring to the pale green colour of the infusion.

8968.name: Happy Fruits Fruit Infusion
8968.description: Apple, grapes, carrot, orange, beetroot, lemongrass, natural flavours.

8126.name: Japan Shincha Organic Green Tea
8126.description: Japan, region Kyushu: it's a precious and rare Sencha First Flush, whose leaves were covered with canvas four weeks before the crop. Thus the leaves produce more chlorophyll and as a consequence they taste more aromatic and creamy. Certified organically grown: IT-BIO-013.

8991.description: Greentea from Japan and China, blackberry leaves and natural aroma of cherry.

8835.name: Jasmine Pearl White Tea
8835.description: It's a mix of pressed green and white tea with a delicate jasmine flavor. It's possible to use one pressed pearl for 2-3 infusions.

8512.name: Jun Shan Silver Needle White Tea
8512.description: Cina, province Hunan near the lake Dung Ting: this kind of tea is exclusively produced by seeds who are covered with a light and silver down. The delicate and bloomy flavor arises thanks to the dehydration of the seed on hot coal.

7833.name: Kukicha Green Tea
7833.description: Kukicha, or twig tea, is a Japanese blend made of stems, stalks, and twigs. Kukicha has a unique flavor and aroma among teas, due to its being composed of parts of the tea plant that are excluded from most other teas. Kukicha has a mildly nutty, and slightly creamy sweet flavor.
7833.ingredients: Kukicha, or twig tea, is a Japanese blend made of stems, stalks, and twigs. Kukicha has a unique flavor and aroma among teas, due to its being composed of parts of the tea plant that are excluded from most other teas. Kukicha has a mildly nutty, and slightly creamy sweet flavor.

9063.name: Lung Ching Superior Green Tea
9063.description: Lung-Ching Superior Grade is harvested at the beginning of the spring season, the leaves are traditionally picked before Tomb-Sweeping Day in April and before the spring rains. When the leaves are infused they unfurl displaying one perfect tea bud and a leaf. The liquor is a beautiful, bright, emerald green and the flavour is smooth, gentle and slightly sweet. The leaves can be infused at least four times, each time releasing more delicate flavour. This tea is a green tea lovers delight.

10436.ingredients: Java green tea has a sweet scent. It has a full bodied and persistent taste, without bitter scents. Certified organically grown: IT-BIO-013.

10403.description: Kabusè in Japanese means "cover" and this is the peculiarity of Kabusecha. It comes from Kagoshima, in southern Japan. In this garden the tea leaves are covered with meshes.
10403.ingredients: A fresh and fragrant aroma,with a higher concentration of mineral salts and vitamin C. In cup the color is green, intense and brilliant; during the infusion the leaves have a particularly sweet flavor, which recalls olive oil.

9984.name: Anji White White Tea
9984.description: Tea originating from the classic green tea province Zhejiang. It is cultivated around Hangzhou, the "tea capital" of this growing region. White leaf tea specialty, processed according to the classic green tea manufacturing method and produced only at the beginning of the spring crop in April/May. In China it is given away at special occasions. Aromatic, fresh and floral taste, has an extremely carefully green leaf and a very bright color in the cup.

7725.name: Green Mate Herbal Tea
7725.description: Yerba Mate (Ilex Paraguanensis leaves) is a popular South American herb that is brewed into a high-caffeine infusion. It is harvested from the leaves and stems of a particular type of holly tree. Yerba mate has a bittersweet flavor. It is traditionally drunk from a hollow gourd through a filtering straw (bombilla).

9668.description: A delicate herbal tea with flowers and herbs from South Tyrol. A well balanced blend with a fresh mint aftertaste.IT-BIO-0013
9668.ingredients: Peppermint, rasperry leaves, lemon balm, elder blossoms, roses, blu bottle, bee balm. Certified organically grown: IT-BIO-013.

10228.name: Melissa Herbal Tea FES
10228.description: La Melissa è una pianta con proprietà calmanti e rilassanti. È una tisana dal sapore fresco; l’olio essenziale, inoltre, conferisce all’infuso una morbida nota agrumata e profumata.
